thread.title: Court records: California woman held on $1.5 million bail after Portland police pull cash, cocaine from her van
thread.title_full: Court records: California woman held on $1.5 million bail after Portland police pull cash, cocaine from her van | OregonLive.com

author: Maxine Bernstein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Court records: California woman held on $1.5 million bail after Portland police pull cash, cocaine from her van
text:
A Multnomah County judge Wednesday increased bail from $500,000 to $1.5 million for a 44-year-old woman arrested on drug allegations.
Portland police pulled over Maribel Padilla about 2:50 p.m. Tuesday for an improper lane change, according to Officer Tim Manzella.
Maribel Padilla, 44 MCSO Padilla was the driver and sole occupant of a 2009 Dodge Journey van. Using a narcotics-sniffing dog, the dog alerted to an odor in the driver side's floorboard, near the hood release latch, Manzella wrote in an affidavit.
Police located 23 wrapped bundles of cash totaling $204,735 in hidden compartments near the front driver's side wheel well area, the affidavit said.
One kilogram of cocaine was recovered from a driver's side hidden compartment, according to police.
Padilla told police she lives in Los Angeles and has no ties to Portland. She told police that she didn't know the drugs or cash were hidden inside the van.
Circuit Court Judge David F. Rees increased Padilla's bail Wednesday after police argued that they feared Padilla would be a flight risk, considering her access to a large amount of cash.
Padilla is being held on allegations of unlawful delivery of cocaine, possession of cocaine and money laundering.
She's being held at the Multnomah County Inverness Jail. Her next court date is Oct. 22.
-- Maxine Bernstein
